p: In the case of 2′-OMTase, Dolutegravir showed an estimated binding free energy (ΔG) of −9.4 kcal/mol, and the inhibition constant was 128.7 nM. Besides, Bictegravir conferred an estimated binding free energy (ΔG) of −8.4 kcal/mol against 2′-OMTase, and the estimated inhibition constant was 0.696 µM. Moreover, both Dolutegravir and Bictegravir were found to be actively interacting with the catalytic site residues (see Table 4) and interacting with the substrate-binding pocket (see Figure 2). The binding free energy of 2′-OMTase with other drug molecules has been given in supplementary information.
